meanings.definition: The state of being fully or excessively filled or supplied.
meanings.sent1: After the feast, his repletion was evident from his satisfied smile.
meanings.sent2: The repletion of the grocery store shelves made her shopping experience quick and easy.
meanings.sent3: The repletion of candy in the jar tempted him to sneak a few pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room in a repletion of joy.
meanings.sent5: The repletion of colors in the painting created a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of filling or supplying fully or excessively.
meanings.sent1: The repletion of the water pitcher ensured everyone stayed hydrated.
meanings.sent2: His repletion of snacks for the party impressed all the guests.
meanings.sent3: The repletion of jokes during the comedy show kept the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her repletion of kindness towards others made her a beloved figure in the community.
meanings.sent5: The repletion of books on the shelf delighted the avid reader.
